wikipedia_page.main: William Stourton, 18th Baron Stourton (1776–1846) was a Roman Catholic  English peer. He is chiefly remembered for the private memoirs of  his relative Maria Fitzherbert, the secret wife of King George IV,  which she  dictated to him, and which formed the basis for her  first  biography, published  by his brother Charles Langdale   in 1856.
